full_summary:
**Underwater Diver Propulsion System Solicitation**

*   **Solicitation Title**:
    + English: Underwater Diver Propulsion System Solicitation
    + French: Demande d'offres - Système de propulsion pour plongeurs sous-marins
*   **Reference Number:** WS4099776366
*   **Amendment Number:** None
*   **Publication Date:** July 14, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date:** July 18, 2023 at 2:00 p.m. (EDT)
*   **Procurement Method:** Competitive Selective Tendering
*   **Solicitation Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
*   **Procurement Category:** Goods (GD)
*   **Industry Classification:** Personal Motorized Watercraft (UNSPSC 25111805)
*   **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   **Regions of Opportunity:** Ontario (except National Capital Region)
*   **Regions of Delivery:** Ontario (except National Capital Region)

This solicitation supersedes an earlier solicitation with the same reference number and an earlier closing date. Suppliers who submitted offers on the previous solicitation (Doc4067316117) may be eligible to bid on this requirement.

The Department of National Defence requires thirty-eight (38) Underwater Diver Propulsion Systems for use by divers in both training and operational scenarios. The contract includes an optional requirement for additional units. Suppliers are expected to provide training services, maintenance services, and spare parts on an as-and-when-requested basis, as indicated in the Task Authorization provided by the Department of National Defence.

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

The solicitation description is as follows:

The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking proposals for a sufficient number of Underwater Diver Propulsion Systems (UDPS) to meet its operational and training requirements. The contract requires the delivery of thirty-eight (38) UDPS within 210 days of contract award. The systems must be robust and reliable, capable of operating in various water conditions, and suitable for both training and operational scenarios.

Only suppliers who previously submitted offers for solicitation Document 4067316117 are eligible to bid on this requirement. Suppliers must meet the requirements outlined in the solicitation documents, which include providing training services, maintenance services, and spare parts on an as-and
